publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5670 Margaret Smith: Royal Highland Showground Relocation—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of the feasibility study funded by Scottish Enterprise Edinburgh and Lothian, the Scottish Executive and the Royal Highland and Agricultural Society of Scotland on the relocation of the society’s Royal Highland Showground from Ingliston to Norton Park on the other side of the A8; notes that relocation has been found to be necessary because of the proposed expansion of Edinburgh Airport; recognises the considerable contribution that the showground makes to the economy of Edinburgh, and congratulates the society on its commitment to remaining in west Edinburgh.

S2M-5670 Royal Highland Showground Relocation (lodged on 28 February 2007) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mike Rumbles*, Alex Johnstone*, Mike Pringle*, Alex Fergusson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*

S2M-5670 Margaret Smith: Royal Highland Showground Relocation—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of the feasibility study funded by Scottish Enterprise Edinburgh and Lothian, the Scottish Executive and the Royal Highland and Agricultural Society of Scotland on the relocation of the society’s Royal Highland Showground from Ingliston to Norton Park on the other side of the A8; notes that relocation has been found to be necessary because of the proposed expansion of Edinburgh Airport; recognises the considerable contribution that the showground makes to the economy of Edinburgh, and congratulates the society on its commitment to remaining in west Edinburgh. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jim Wallace, Mike Rumbles, Alex Johnstone, Mike Pringle, Alex Fergusson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-5670 Royal Highland Showground Relocation (lodged on 28 February 2007) Nora Radcliffe*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S2M-5670 Royal Highland Showground Relocation (lodged on 28 February 2007) Susan Deacon*
S2M-5670 Royal Highland Showground Relocation (lodged on 28 February 2007) Donald Gorrie*, Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-5670 Margaret Smith: Royal Highland Showground Relocation—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of the feasibility study funded by Scottish Enterprise Edinburgh and Lothian, the Scottish Executive and the Royal Highland and Agricultural Society of Scotland on the relocation of the society’s Royal Highland Showground from Ingliston to Norton Park on the other side of the A8; notes that relocation has been found to be necessary because of the proposed expansion of Edinburgh Airport; recognises the considerable contribution that the showground makes to the economy of Edinburgh, and congratulates the society on its commitment to remaining in west Edinburgh. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jim Wallace, Mike Rumbles, Alex Johnstone, Mike Pringle, Alex Fergusson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Susan Deacon, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop
